question_text:
Which sign makes the statement true?
$30600$ ___ $5.060 \times 10^4$
question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution:
Express the second number in standard form. Look at $10^4$. The 10 is raised to the power of 4. You want to move the decimal point 4 places to the right. First, write an extra zero to the right of the decimal point. Remember that writing extra zeros to the right of a decimal does not change its value.
$5.060 = 5.0600$

Now move the decimal point 4 places to the right.
$5.0600 \rightarrow 50600$
